question.text: A woman whose mother was colourblind and father was haemophilic, marries a colourblind haemophilic man. What is true about their daughters?

options.text: All their daughters are colourblind and haemophilic
They may have daughters who neither suffer from colourblindness nor from haemophilia
They may have daughters who are colourblind or haemophilic
Some of their daughters are colourblind, but not haemophilic

solution.text: The genotype of woman: X<sup>c</sup>X<sup>h</sup>, the genotype of man: X<sup>ch</sup>Y, genotypes of daughters: X<sup>c</sup>X<sup>ch</sup> (colourblind and haemophilic carrier) and X<sup>h</sup>X<sup>ch</sup> (haemophilic and colourblind carrier), the genotype of sons: X<sup>c</sup>Y (colourblind) and X<sup>h</sup>Y (haemophilic).
